author: Macer Hall
title: Stoke by-election threatened by Storm Doris a voters could stay home | Politics | News | Express.co.uk
text: GETTY The crucial Stoke by-election could hang on the edge of a knife with storm Doris coming in The spokesman said: “It is very finely balanced in Stoke. Storm Doris could make all the difference as our voters are more committed while many of Labour’s are likely to be apathetic. Brexit-backing voters need to get behind our man, Paul Nuttall, who is the only true Brexiteer in the battle.” Labour is defending a general election majority of 5,179 over nearest challengers Ukip. The by-election was triggered by the resignation of former Labour MP Tristram Hunt. GETTY The presence of Storm Doris could force voters to stay indoors In tomorrow's other by-election in Copeland, Cumbria, Tory chiefs are confident of snatching a seat from Labour while in government for the first time since 1983. Brexit-backing voters need to get behind our man, Paul Nuttall, who is the only true Brexiteer in the battle Ukip spokesman Labour is defending a majority of 2,564 over the Tories in Copeland, where the party’s former MP Jamie Reed quit to take up a job in the nuclear industry. Tory Defence Secretary Sir Michael Fallon insisted his party was hopeful of achieving victory. UKIP MEP Paul Nuttall visits the Roma ghetto in Sofia Wed, February 1, 2017
